description:
A new version as natural as possible  in LRGB 

Even if this image is in colors , I can say that I always loved galaxies in black and white .... maybe a because of my 1980 's backgroung with 103Ao film and technical pan 2415  ;-)  

-------------------------
Many thanks to all the Sadr team for the acquisition of 811 subs of 300s in L, and RGB Bin1 taken during one year span from October 2018 and October 2019 with the 14'' newton setup of Sadr
Observatory in Chili during 21 nights.

I only kept the 297 best subs with FWHM and eccentricity criterias which represents 25.4 hours of exposure.

Red 26 subs@300s -20째C gain high
Blue 31 subs@300s -20째C gain high
Green 40 subs@300s -20째C gain high
Light 208 subs@300s -20째C, gain high

Total exposure : 25.1 hours

NGC 1365 is barred spiral galaxy and most beautiful member of Fornax cluster.
title: NGC1365 LRGB- Sadr  Version2
